summary: This bill, S. 1857, amends Title 14 of the United States Code to mandate the retention of certain enlisted members of the Coast Guard who have completed 18 or more years of service but have not yet reached 20 years. This applies to both regular and reserve components, preventing involuntary separation or denial of reenlistment until they qualify for retirement or specified time periods. The bill also includes a clerical amendment to update the chapter analysis.
